docs.title: MolBase
docs.text:
Welcome to the public documentation for MolBase — a hybrid AI + RDKit-based molecular search engine.

📌 Note: This project is home-hosted. The live demo is generally available between 9 AM and 5 PM EST. If the link is temporarily down, please refer to this documentation to explore features, architecture, and usage.

👉 Live Demo

docs.title: 📌 Overview
docs.text:
MolBase is a full-stack chemical search platform that combines traditional RDKit-based structure search with neural embedding similarity powered by a custom Graph Neural Network (GNN).

It supports:

  • Substructure, GNN powered substructure, exact, and similarity search
  • Explore a dataset of over 6 million molecules imported from PubChem
  • Sketch or input molecule structures to search
  • Compare traditional RDKit vs. learned GNN-based search
  • Visualize results with embedded SVG renderers

docs.title: 📷 Demo
docs.text: GNN powered substructure search on a database of over 6 million molecules returning instantaneous results

docs.title: 📁 Docs
docs.text:
• Features – Core functionality and tools used
  • Architecture – How the platform is built
  • Setup Instructions – How it runs in Docker

docs.title: 🏗️ Architecture
docs.text: MolBase follows a modular architecture designed for scalability and GPU acceleration.

docs.title: Components
docs.text:
• Frontend: React + Material UI
  • Backend: Hybrid .NET + FastAPI
  • Database: PostgreSQL with RDKit & pgvector
  • GNN Model: PyTorch-based molecular embedding
  • Worker: Celery tasks for parsing, import, training, etc.
  • Reverse Proxy: Caddy with Docker Compose

docs.title: 🔐 Authentication
docs.text:
MolBase offers a secure and seamless login experience via:

  • OAuth login via Google, Microsoft, Facebook, or Github

  • Email-based registration

  • Email verification for user to be activated

  • Username based login

  • Optional 2FA for enhanced security

  • Email based password reset

  • Guest user login session

docs.title: 🏠 Main Application View
docs.text:
After login, users land on the Molecule Search Dashboard.

  • Search bar with toggle for exact, substructure, and similarity modes
  • Load More results system with real-time filters
  • Dark mode enabled by default for improved focus

docs.title: 🔎 Molecule Search
docs.text:
• Substructure Search using RDKit and PostgreSQL
  • Similarity Search using vector embeddings and pgvector
  • Results are ranked and clickable for details

docs.title: 🎨 Molecule Visualization
docs.text:
• Each result displays a live SVG rendering using OpenChemLib
  • Click to view metadata, SMILES, or copy structure
  • Tooltips for long names and tag displays

docs.title: 🧠 AI-Driven Similarity
docs.text:
• Uses GNN with SimCLR-style training
  • Embeddings stored in pgvector for lightning-fast comparisons
  • Includes top-k similarity ranking vs. anchor molecule

docs.title: 📦 Dataset
docs.text:
• 6M+ molecules imported from PubChem
  • Filterable by tags, source, weight, or structure

docs.title: ⚙️ Setup Instructions
docs.text: NOTE: This documentation is for demonstration only. Source code is private.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Docker + Docker Compose
  • NVIDIA GPU with drivers (for GNN training)

docs.title: Local Deployment (Optional)
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/youruser/molbase-docs
cd molbase
docker compose up --build

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: For actual code access, contact the author for a private walkthrough.
